poem:
**A Brief Illumination**  

In the quiet interim of change,  
a house pauses on its breath,  
lights dimmed to a whisper,  
the walls listening—   
two weeks of borrowed glow,  
before the dark contracts,  
asking new arrivals to pledge  
a promise of warmth,  
their hopeful flickers boxed  
into the chessboard of simple living,  
one square of light at a time.
